memberdef.argsstring: (const char *portName, const char *cameraId, int maxBuffers, size_t maxMemory, int priority, int stackSize, int maxPvAPIFrames)
memberdef.name: prosilica

briefdescription.para: Constructor for Prosilica driver; most parameters are simply passed to ADDriver::ADDriver.

detaileddescription.para:
After calling the base class constructor this method creates a thread to collect the detector data, and sets reasonable default values for the parameters defined in this class, asynNDArrayDriver and ADDriver.
portName
The name of the asyn port driver to be created.
cameraId
The uniqueId, IP address or IP DNS name of the camera to be connected to this driver.
maxBuffers
The maximum number of NDArray buffers that the NDArrayPool for this driver is allowed to allocate. Set this to -1 to allow an unlimited number of buffers.
maxMemory
The maximum amount of memory that the NDArrayPool for this driver is allowed to allocate. Set this to -1 to allow an unlimited amount of memory.
priority
The thread priority for the asyn port driver thread if ASYN_CANBLOCK is set in asynFlags.
stackSize
The stack size for the asyn port driver thread if ASYN_CANBLOCK is set in asynFlags.
maxPvAPIFrames
The number of frame buffers to use in the PvAPI library driver. Default=MAX_PVAPI_FRAMES=2.

briefdescription.para: Connects driver to device; This method is called when the driver's pasynCommon->connect() function is called.

detaileddescription.para:
It uses the class variable deviceIsReachable to determine whether to call asynPortDriver::connect(), which in turn calls pasynManager::exceptionConnect() to signal that the driver is connected to the underlying hardware. Derived classes can override this method if they need to handle connect() calls in a more complex way. For example, with a network camera that can be temporarily unreachable the driver could attempt to connect to the camera each time that connect() is called.
pasynUser
The pasynUser structure which contains information about the port and address

briefdescription.para: Called when asyn clients call pasynInt32->write().

detaileddescription.para:
This function performs actions for some parameters, including ADAcquire, ADBinX, etc. For all parameters it sets the value in the parameter library and calls any registered callbacks..
pasynUser
pasynUser structure that encodes the reason and address.
value
Value to write.

briefdescription.para: Called when asyn clients call pasynFloat64->write().

detaileddescription.para:
This function performs actions for some parameters, including ADAcquireTime, ADGain, etc. For all parameters it sets the value in the parameter library and calls any registered callbacks..
pasynUser
pasynUser structure that encodes the reason and address.
value
Value to write.

Prints details about the driver if details>0. It then calls the ADDriver::report() method.
fp
File pointed passed by caller where the output is written to.
details
If >0 then driver details are printed.

briefdescription.para: This function gets called in a thread from the PvApi library when a new frame arrives.

memberdef.argsstring: (void *Context, tPvInterface Interface, tPvLinkEvent Event, unsigned long UniqueId)
memberdef.name: cameraLinkCallback

briefdescription.para: Sync the camera time with an EPICS timestamp.
Driver for Prosilica GigE and CameraLink cameras using their PvApi library.
